ratings.comment: This professor is one of the best at the University of Iowa. He genuinely cares about your learning and provides fair grading with helpful feedback. The class includes many discussions, so if you're not comfortable speaking up, it might not be for you. Overall, a great course with an excellent professor. I rate this course and professor 10/10.
Class had lot of good material.  The lectures weren't the most engaging to listen to but had a lot of meat in it.

Rick is a terrible professor and I regret taking this class with him. He's excessively controlling during lectures and inhibits free conversation by keeping his finger on the mute button and requiring people to raising hands on zoom. I have never observed another professor do this, and its extremely counterproductive. Very strange for an MBA class.

I really liked Rick's Foundations in Strategy class at University of Iowa (MBA level). He's a nice, down to earth guy and all he cares about is that you're showing you "get" course concepts. He's not concerned with writing style, etc for case briefs. He keeps you engaged/on your toes with polls and other creative ways. 10/10 would take again.

Seemed like another lecturer's class format was used, and he didn't check all the quiz questions for quality. He tried hard to keep online classes engaging (hard thing to do). Rick genuinely cares about his students and does his best to help. He and graders follow assignment rubrics very closely. Participate in online sessions to max your grade.

I had Rick for MHR 300 and thought he was really nice and easy to listen to. He seems like he genuinely cares about his students. The concepts of this class were fairly simple, and the textbook material was really easy to understand. We had discussion posts, responses, and quizzes every week, but they were very easy.

Was really excited for this class but I did not learn anything. Spent a lot of time talking about himself/personal experiences that had nothing to do with the material. Required an expensive simulation but it was useless, said attendance is optional but emails 3 times if you miss a day. Also he was intrusive and asked a lot of personal questions.
Worst professor I have ever taken. Beware

This instructor did not make sense and did not discuss the course topic in virtually any of the material. The simulation for the course is not a strong learning tool.  The instructor seemed to be confused as to what ethics is and how to convey the material

Nothing in this class is difficult, but Rick insists on being unreasonable when it comes time to grade. This is why so few students receive A's, and so many students disagree with his feedback. Also is way too intrusive: no explicit attendance policy, but insists on prying when you miss class.

I absolutely hated the group project that makes up so much of your grade and Rick does grade it fairly hard. We thought his grading was somewhat subjective and nit-picky. However, the class was mostly interesting overall despite the terrible group work and he does seem to genuinely care about his students.
